Description: Painted pottery shabti of P3-Rʿ-ẖtp with a blue lappet-wig with red and yellow braids, a modelled brown face with black eyes, a red and yellow collar that encloses the crossed brown hands in relief holding a single hoe; the back is decorated with a representation of a red and yellow seed-basket hanging from one shoulder; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs on a yellow ground, the back of the leg section is inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in three(surviving) rows of black painted Hieroglyphs; the lower leg section has broken away.
